title: Performance Analyst (Real Estate/Title Insurance Industry)
job_overview:
PLEASE APPLY THROUGH THIS LINK: 
Upgrade to see actual info

About Us:
With over 100 years of combined industry experience, the Community Minerals team specializes in the purchase of mineral or royalty rights all over the US. We have earned a stellar reputation with hundreds of satisfied customers and an “A” Rating with the Better Business Bureau. With our proven track record, we continue to serve mineral owners in several states with transparency, accountability, and a personalized experience to meet individual needs.

Job Summary:
The Performance Analyst will be responsible for processing business processes and initiatives to ensure the attainment of the organization’s goals and objectives. This role is also responsible for activities that support the creation and management of dashboards and reports, which will guide the management’s decision-making process. 

Job Description:
Building and designing reports from multiple data sources, exported from varied systems and tools
Generating and updating daily, weekly, monthly, and yearly KPI reports to be used in tracking and evaluating team performance 
Work in direct partnership with leadership to understand the organization's needs around data analysis and data processing aimed toward implementing data-driven decisions 
Accountable for real-time reporting, documenting, and diagnosing trends on key performance metrics. 
Implementing processes for data collection, cleanup, maintenance, analysis, forecasting, and validation for organization-wide data 
Execute marketing response forecasts and own the development and implementation of staffing and metric models, reporting, and analysis. 
Develop, maintain, and update process-related handbooks for all aspects of the role


Qualifications:
Education:
Bachelor’s Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Data Science or a related field

Experience:
1-3 years of experience in performance metric analysis
Proven experience in data analysis, report generation, and performance analysis is required
Experience in data analysis tools and software is a plus
Experience with cross-functional teams and collaborating with leadership is a plus
Prior US Title Company work experience highly preferred

Technical Skills:
Proficiency in CRM Software
Must have Structured Query Language Skills 
Intermediate to advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel/ Google Sheets
Inquisitive and analytical to understand root causes and patterns in data
Experience in workforce management with a call center company is an advantage 
Strong knowledge of data collection, data clean-up, and data visualization techniques
Familiarity with statistical analysis and forecasting techniques

Additional Skills:
Excellent Organization skills to handle multiple tasks within set deadlines 
Excellent oral and written communication skills to effectively convey information and develop presentations for multiple levels of the organization
Strong quantitative skills in data management and application of statistical tools and models 
Problem-solving and analytical skills
Ability to work independently and as part of a team 

System Requirements:
To ensure optimal performance and functionality while using different web and application tools, please make sure that your systeUpgrade to see actual infoets the following requirements:

Operating System:
- Windows: Windows 8.1 (64-bit) or higher
- macOS: macOS 10.13 (High Sierra) or higher

Processor:
- Intel: Skylake-class 6th Gen i3, i5, or i7 processor or higher
- AMD: Excavator-class (2015) processor or higher

Memory (RAM):
- A minimum of 8 GB of RAM is required.

Job Type: Full-time


Benefits:
Health insurance
Life insurance
Schedule: 8-hour shift
